content: I am a Ph.D. candidate at CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security and at Saarland University advised by Michael Backes. My research focus is on usable security for user authentication. My main research interest centers on passwords, multi-factor authentication, and passwordless authentication with FIDO2/WebAuthn. The results of my works have been published at top tier conferences like USENIX Security and IEEE S&P.

title: Sanam Ghorbani Lyastani
Is FIDO2 the Kingslayer of User Authentication? A Comparative Usability Study of FIDO2 Passwordless Authentication
Better managed than memorized? Studying the Impact of Managers on Password Strength and Reuse
Poster: Improving Password Memorability and Strength Using Mangling Rules
